title: Promotion Series held hostage by trolls, remove series
body:
I'm tried of that feeling of stress knowing that i will probably get a really bad team in promos, but the worst thing is that if you get a troll, or rager, your done. 

2-2 in promos to platnium 5 from gold 1. 

first 2 games are wins

next game has 2 afks  on my side

next game I played poorly and lost

The next game is just fucking unfair, is here is why...

We are winning hard but my jungle isnt letting me have blues, me being wukong and our only source of CC, I take the 6th blue to get lower CDR on my ult in case one of us needs to disengage / engage. However our jungler who is feeding btw rages at me and says "ill get you back for this". I carry the game really hard and we push to nexus, but right before it dies he makes a surrender vote and EVERYONE ON MY TEAM accepts. Afterwards they all flame me saying "you shouldn't have taken blue, now you are losing your promos for it".

Riot this is fucking stupid. i carried that game fair and square, didn't even use that chat at all so you KNOW i didn't rage at anyone, but these trolls decide to ruin my game that I had 100% won by troll surrendering.The entire idea of promos is stupid to begin with, **if you repeatedly get to 100lp, you obviously deserve to move up the next rank, why the fuck do I have to play 3 games with lower MMR allies and higher MMR enemies to prove that? With the risk of trolls like the ones added on top of that*

replies.body:
This is exactly why I have not bothered with ranked matches this season and only bothered minimally with last season. I played for placement to receive rewards and that was it. The current unchanging system of advancement does not measure a person's skill. Rather, it relies 100% on blind luck. Even if you have decent teammates, the order of champion selection countering previous selections can end the game in a cruel rock-paper-scissors dynamic before the game even begins. 

Ranked matches for solo players are not fair. 5-man ranked is not practical for casual players.
Unless you treat LoL like it is your profession, you see no semblance of balance.

The removal of the promo series is the best quick solution, because someone is lucky enough if they manage to reach 100 LP and displayed some skill. This will have people promoted quicker, but is that a bad thing? They will move up until they enter a league that is beyond them, and fluctuate between that one and the lower until they improve to the point they can securely continue their upward progress. 

As is, I have 0 interest in ranked matches. Z.E.R.O.

I am tired of the AFKs.

I am tired of the disconnections.

I am tired of the skill gap between players.

I am tired.

I would much rather create a custom Hide n Seek match that earns no IP than play ranked, because at least I will have fun.
I only play normals because of this. I don't know why but people play 10x worst in ranked than they do in normals. Which is ridiculous because normals is usually people trying out champs.

I was kinda forced into dodging myself due to them. And I'm in my promos, which I have 2 losses in now. I completely Agree. Riot needs to get rid of the promos. That is the only easy solution to this.

The series design makes this game much less fun than it could be. It's that simple. It should be if you reach 100 LP you go up, if you reach 0 you go down. There would be more movement, which is not a bad thing, and things would just feel more fluid. Dropping wouldn't feel as bad because you know you can just keep playing and you'll go back up. If you get a troll or afk it's less stressful because you're not in a situation where if you lose your series you have to climb up all over again and then go through another unpleasant series just to get back to where you were.

Math dictates players that win more often than not will climb until their win rate hits a 50% average. Series do NOTHING to add to or improve that working mathematical model.

Well, I will say that the buffs are in the jungle and no laner is outright entitled to any of them. You can make your claims, but the jungle is the jungle and he's got the smite.

But honestly, in this situation, it doesn't really matter. You weren't some mid who can't manage mana, you were a guy being pragmatic and wanting that 10% cooldown to make good use of your cc (some junglers don't need blue late-game anyway, as a jungle main I can testify to this). 

Your team were assholes, I'll give you that.

They're the junglers until teamfights start/midgame. After that they're whoever is there to take them (Usually adc+mid) since nobody _needs_ blue lategame.

That said, if I'm jungling and people get unreasonably angry at not getting a buff I generally won't let them have it on principle, it doesn't hurt them to be nice.
Many mids NEED blue even in late game. I play a lot of Diana and Ziggs, and I turn into a mid game-late game powerhouse with blue.
